links.title: A Peek Into The Markets: U.S. Stock Futures Climb; Facebook Earnings In Focus
links.description: Pre-open movers U.S. stock futures traded higher in early pre-market trade. Facebook Inc (NASDAQ: FB), QUALCOMM, Inc. (NASDAQ: QCOM) and Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA) will release earnings after the closing bell. Data on motor vehicle sales for October will be released today. The ADP national employment report for October will be released at 8:15 a.m.

links.title: The Worm Has Obviously Turned
links.description: The Worm Has Obviously Turned "Honey Badger Don't Care" -- Randall The Honey Badger You do know what they say about the honey badger. $TSLA Nomura Instinet reiterates Buy rating on Tesla ahead of earnings. https://stocknews.com/news/tsla-analyst-buy-tesla-inc-tsla-regardless-of-earnings-results/

links.title: Analyst: Buy Tesla Inc (TSLA) Regardless Of Earnings Results
links.description: Tesla Inc (NASDAQ:TSLA) will likely report weak earnings results today after the closing bell, but investors shouldn't get too hung up on the company's short-term difficulties. That's the message this week from Nomura Instinet, which reiterated its Buy rating on the electric automaker, noting Tesla will eventually figure out its production issues with the new Model 3 sedan.

links.title: Top 3 Earnings Today- Facebook Inc (FB) Stock, Tesla Inc (TSLA) Stock, QUALCOMM, Inc. (QCOM) Stock
links.description: Shares of Mark Zuckerberg led Facebook Inc (NASDAQ:FB) have picked up some momentum ahead of the social media company's Q3 earnings gaining nearly 6% over the past three trading sessions. The Menlo Park, California-based company is scheduled to report its Q3 earnings today after the closing bell.

messages.body: $TSLA (Tesla) Quarterly loss likely to be brushed off as investors look for update on sales and manufacturing issues http://on.mktw.net/2zNYo3w

links.title: Tesla earnings: Model 3 production, demand under the microscope
links.description: By Through delays, recalls, and wildly optimistic projections, Wall Street has stuck with Tesla Inc. shares, which have gained three times as much as the benchmark this year. Tesla is expected to report a third-quarter loss after the bell Wednesday, but that too is likely to be brushed off.
